column5: Did a five day fishing trip to Lake Temiskaming and stayed on the Quebec side at the mouth of the Kipawa river, man what a beautiful spot. We had two cabins (14 of us) right beside the river and the white water rapids filled the air like music. Right off the bat the fishing was good, couple days a big storm hit and shut things down for a bit but after awhile it picked up only windy and a bit more boat control needed. Most of the Pickeral were around 3 pounds with a couple over 4 with only a few smaller,couple pike and even the odd smallie. Had a nice fish fry one night, most took home a couple and the rest were released...  First night   Average size   Me with a few   Another nice one   View from the cabin deck   Couple of the boys did some tubing    Then some Kayakers came by and gave us a show     Fishing the mouth of the Kipawa   A good one   Me again   This was my second year there with last year solid rain and cold, but had a blast this year and plan on going next year...
Very nice.  What a great looking river.  Looks like you had a great time.  Any pike for the tourney?  Joey
nice walleyes u got there. Looks like you had great time.

Awesome report.  Looks like a great spot you've found there.  Beautiful view of the river from the deck.  Must have made for some great nights hearing that river running in the background as you fall asleep.  Nice pickerel too!  Corn Nug
Nice... WTG man, thanks for sharing the reports... keeps many of us from going insane when we are unable to go out..
No Joey, none of the Pike were mine, but I'm still lookin for one...
What a beautiful spot you got yourself there.  I can understand why you want to keep going back.
WOW...thats a great report & pics...man they were some real nice walleyes you guys caught must have been fish after fish,that river looks fantastic....wish i was there,thanks for sharing   cheers
nice.thanks for sharing those pics looks like a great time.
Good haul there, partner.  Congrats, nice scenery!
Wow I was just loving that report .Thanks
Nice report and pics Bill.
Nice Pics and pics.
what a beautiful spot. Thanks for sharing.
Nice report. Gezz you got me thinking of a trip there with my buds. Thanks for sharing
Some nice eyes there. Excellent Report and Pics!!     Thanks for sharing.  That lake is definitely on my lists of places to go sometime down the road.  FOTB
Looks like an awesome place. Thanks for the report and all the great pics.
Congrats,nice pics  BM

Awesome, Im always looking for other things to do while on week long trips besides nap in the afternoon, tubing looks like a great way to switch it up from floating in the boat all day for a week straight. AWESOME looking spot........how'd you guys talk to each other all trip though with the water rumbling in the backround all the time lol.
ahhhhhhhhhhh

Hey all glad ya's like the report and thanks for all the cool replies. Have been getting some question on who is the outfitters, this place is all private and the guys I know have been going the same weekend for 10yrs or so, someone dropped out and I got the invite. The fellow that owns it used to run it as a lodge for the owner in the U.S. for years and now is full all season with repeat stays, a lot of families from all over go there and only spring or fall for fishing trips. The weekend after we leave it a big kayak event on the river and it's just packed with kayakers. The best I can suggest for that area would be Lake Kipawa and can find some outfitters on the net. But I'll tell ya it quite the spot.  Regards Bill.
